timeline.message:
Provide a way to customize gRPC Status mapping rule

Motivation:

When an exception is raised, the exception is converted to gRPC Status by:
- `GrpcStatus.fromThrowable()` provided by Armeria
  https://github.com/line/armeria/blob/ca2c25fde0d5a2ae7f4d99a4e511ef307e1fa5fa/grpc/src/main/java/com/linecorp/armeria/internal/common/grpc/GrpcStatus.java#L76-L80
- `Status.fromThrowable()` provided by gRPC-Java
  https://github.com/grpc/grpc-java/blob/3811ef3d22f90ae8da8200964d178cbd829ee9f8/api/src/main/java/io/grpc/Status.java#L390-L396

However, there is no extension point that allows users to map an exception to gRPC status.

Modifications:

- Add `registerException()` that maps an excepiton class to gRPC status.
  ```
  import com.linecorp.armeria.common.grpc.GrpcStatus;

  GrpcStatus.registerException(AccessDeniedException.class, Status.UNAUTHENTICATED);
  ```
- Rename `internal.GrpcStatus` to `internal.GrpcStatusUtil` for avoiding naming conflicts.

Result:

- You can now override the default gRPC mapping rule using `GrpcStatus.registerException()`.
- Fixes: #3191
